thread.title: Israel Restaurant Cuts Bill in Half for Jewish and Arabs Eating Together
thread.title_full: Israel Restaurant Cuts Bill in Half for Jewish and Arabs Eating Together

author: Ryan Haas
title: Israel Restaurant Cuts Bill in Half for Jewish and Arabs Eating Together
text:
Share Photo credit: Chen Leopold | Flash90 
Amid violence in the state of Israel, a restaurant near the coastal city of Netanya recently started offering a unique promotion deal in an effort to thwart rising tensions. 
Hummus Bar at the M Mall in Kfar Vitkin is offering their food at 50 percent off at tables that seat Jews and Arabs together. 
Kobi Tzafrir, the manager of the restaurant, told The Times of Israel Monday that since it began last week, the promotion has been a success. 
Hummus Bar recently took a coexistence approach following a series of deadly attacks in Israel in an effort to bring people together. 
“Scared of Arabs? Scared of Jews?” the restaurant wrote in a Hebrew-language Facebook post . “By us we don’t have Arabs! But we also don’t have Jews… By us we’ve got human beings! And real excellent Arab hummus! And great Jewish falafel! And a free refill for every serving of hummus, whether you’re Arab, Jewish, Christian, Indian, etc.” 
Tzafrir said that since posting the promotion and Facebook post on Oct. 13, Hummus Bar had served several tables with both Arabs and Jews. 
The kitchen prepares kosher food, and therefore halal as well, meaning the only thing stopping observant Jews and Muslims is the desire to dine together on the hummus with stewed chickpeas and msabaha — warm chickpeas swimming in tahini. 
“If there’s anything that can bring together these peoples, it’s hummus,” Tzafrir said.
